name: World Wide Web Foundation
goal:
Founded by inventor of the world wide web, Sir Tim Berners-Lee, we work towards a free and open web for everyone that is a public good. We deliver digital equality by securing policy change through partnerships and coalitions. We believe in the power of working together, so we work with a wide range of actors from governments, businesses, and civil society to understand the issues, advocate, and collaborate to deliver change.
We also advocate based on evidence. Our work is evidence-based, meaning that our conversations with policy makers — and our related advocacy campaigns — are rooted in robust research, often our own.
Finally, we experiment and innovate. What works in one country or city won’t necessarily work in another, so our local coalitions and Labs tailor solutions to local realities.
